section.name: Installation
section.p: This document describes how to install and configure the WMS Data Handler. The following sections can be found in this document:

section.name: Distribution Contents
section.p: This release of the WMS Data Handler requires Java Standard Edition 1.7 or higher. The handler is shipped in a self-contained TAR/ZIP file. Below is an illustration of the handler distribution after it has been expanded:

ul.li:
bin - this directory contains handler executables. The current release has a single executable.
wms - this single command initiates discovery and ingestion of new imagery product from the provider server.

config - this directory contains handler/server configuration information.
horizon_client.lcf - this is a log configuration file for the handler distribution.
horizon_config.pm - this is a global command launcher script that gets included by both the handler and server launchers.
horizon_domain.cfg - this is the interface file that contains the URL mapping to the Manager Web Service.
tie_datahandler.xml - this is the springframework configuration to assemble the data handler.
tie_producttypes.xml - this file lists all the product type and configuration information of the handler to communicate with the provider
lib - this directory contains all run-time libraries for both handler and server applications.
useHORIZON.csh - the file is a script for setting up the environment.

subsection.name: Regarding the useHORIZON.csh script
subsection.p: The useHORIZON.csh is a environment setting script.

The script assumes your Java distribution is installed under /user/local/java if JAVA_HOME is not set. The script also assumes the user is sourcing it within the WMS distribution directory. For multi-user operation environment, the line below should be modified with the correct directory path.
subsection.source: % setenv HORIZON <path to the WMS Data Handler software distribution>/config
subsection.p: HORIZON_LOGGING is used to specify where log files should be written to. The default value is current directory, however, it should point to appropriate location.
subsection.source: % setenv HORIZON_LOGGING <path to directory for log files>

subsection.name: Regarding the horizon_domain.xml file
subsection.p: The domain file contains connection lookup information. It is a simple federation to URL mapping file. WMS Data Handler uses this file to lookup the federation connection string.

The domain file above defines federation name horizonDev as the default federation to the handler distribution. The <federation></federation> block contains the mapping from the federation name to the URL that the handler will use to establish connection. Optionally, the <federation></federation> block can contain <productType></productType> elements, which defines product types to federation mapping.

subsection.name: Logger Configuration
subsection.p: The WMS handler uses log4j for logging messages to file (optionally) and onto the screen. All logger configuation managed under the horizon_client.lcf. The example below changes the logging level to TRACE.

subsection.name: Product Type Configuration
subsection.p: The WMS handler operates according to the product type configuration file, tie_producttypes.xml. For each product type, the handler looks for the connection endpoint and the set of file it should excpect for each imagery product.
